screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Settings" menu of a smartphone. It shows various options for adjusting keyboard settings, such as language selection, text correction, glide typing, voice typing, and dictionary. There are also settings for theme preferences and a search option at the bottom. The user can modify these options to customize their typing experience.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.
click on the "System" option located at the middle-lower part of the screen.
click on the "Languages & input" located at the upper left.
click on the "Virtual keyboard" settings located at the left and upper middle part of the screen.
click on the "Gboard Multilingual typing" option located at the upper left side of the screen.

think.Thought: The user wants to change the appearance of the keyboard. The current screen shows various settings related to Gboard, including theme options, but the theme is likely the section the user should adjust to modify the keyboard's look. As the user has navigated to Gboard's multilingual typing settings, the next logical step is to find the theme settings and adjust them accordingly.
Future Action Plan: Click on the 'Theme' option located in the 'Gboard' settings.
